required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study to Assess the Frequency of Lidocaine Ineffectiveness in Hard-to-treat ADHD
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Lidocaine Ineffectiveness in Those With Hard-to-treat ADHD

brief_summary.textblock: This work will assess the prevalence in hard-to-treat ADHD of the ineffectiveness of the anesthetic Lidocaine.

detailed_description.textblock: Using a non-invasive, pain-free, taste-based approach to assess lidocaine effectiveness, the study will assess the frequency of ineffectiveness in the target population.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Using a taste-based test before and after the application of lidocaine gel to the tongue, we will assess the degree to which lidocaine is effective at blocking taste in those with hard-to-treat ADHD
study_design_info.masking_description: The scoring of the lidocaine test is masked, using the coded identity of the tastes. The tastes will be assessed in random order. The subjects and other study personnel will be told not to discuss what the subject could or couldn't taste. Scoring will not be shared with the testing site until all testing is complete. This is one of the last studies with an IRB for each arm and site. Hence it appears to be a single arm, but the other arms are separately registered with ClinicalTrials.gov

primary_outcome.measure: Observational Study: Number of Participants With Lidocaine Ineffectiveness by Taste Test in Hard-to-treat ADHD
primary_outcome.time_frame: on day of testing, approximately 30 minutes for clinic visit
primary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to identify each taste and its intensity.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Observational study of prevalence in hard-to-treat ADHD
arm_group.description: Subjects will be tested with lidocaine gel.

intervention.arm_group_label: Observational study of prevalence in hard-to-treat ADHD

patient_data.ipd_description: The investigators plan to submit for publication descriptions of what was accomplished, and the evaluations as described in the study, including the incidence of lidocaine ineffectiveness in those with ADHD and in the general population.

group.title: Hard-to-treat ADHD
group.description: Subjects will be tested with Septodont 5% oral lidocaine gel (NDC 0362-0221-10), 75 mg pre-measured by compounding pharmacy and dispensed into blister pack

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This was an observational study without controls, as there were no controls available at the site. NeurAbilities is a clinic dedicated to treating patients with neurological diagnoses. To do statistics, the study will need to be repeated at a site that can provide controls.
